DataElement.preferredDefinition: The microscope field diameter using millimeters (mm) as the unit of measure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An optical instrument that uses a combination of lenses to produce magnified images of very small objects_The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents._The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An optical instrument that uses a combination of lenses to produce magnified images of very small objects

ReferenceDocuments.name: Instructional Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: CAP Nottingham Score 2017: This element is not required for accreditation purposes and considered optional; may be clinically important but is not yet validated or regularly used in patient management.
